	AngularJS template with configurable options.
	Use the `options` object to control dynamic behavior.
	Example: Display an element when max row count is 10:
	<div ng-if="options.maxRowCount === 10"></div>
	The `skeleton-container` class is used for loading placeholders.
-->

	<!-- Body Skeleton -->

	<div class="skeleton-box skeleton-line small"></div>

</div></placeholder_template><preserve_placeholder_size>false</preserve_placeholder_size><roles/><short_description/><size>md</size><sp_column display_value="1">2fbb50e5c3fb22104d7636dc0501313d</sp_column><sp_widget display_value="Topic Header">10e99777c38830105a09f0ad9840ddbd</sp_widget><sys_class_name>sp_instance</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-05 00:37:58</sys_created_on><sys_id>35db9cedc3bb22104d7636dc05013136</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_name/><sys_package display_value=" Mock SkillUp" source="x_snc_mock_skillup">389364c69f9322107f44bcf72024ab3f</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value=" Mock SkillUp">389364c69f9322107f44bcf72024ab3f</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sp_instance_35db9cedc3bb22104d7636dc05013136</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-05 00:38:57</sys_updated_on><title/><url/><widget_parameters><![CDATA[{
